channel.title: Making some sweet graphixs [Tut]
channel.description:
[b]Purpose:[/b] [i]Make a spiral techno Backround for siggys and avatars.[/i]
[b]Difficulty:[/b] [i]4/10[/i]
[b]Assumed Knowledge:[/b] [i]Know where to click, reading, and interperting, AND NOT TAKING REAL TOOLS[/i]
[b]Program:[/b] [i]Adobe ImageReady[/i]
[b][u]Procedure[/u][/b]
[b]Original Steps:[/b] [b]Step 1:[/b] [i]First open up a Blank Page about 150x200[/i]
[b]Step 2:[/b] [i]Take out your pen and scrible like this[/i] [IMG]http://img141.imageshack.us/img141/4371/tutkd0.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 3:[/b] [i]Then take out your paint bucket and fill some spaces in[/i] [IMG]http://img134.imageshack.us/img134/899/tutje6.jpg[/img]
[b]Option Step:[/b]
[i]If you cant find the pain bucket and pen on ImageReady, Use these steps[/i]
[b]Step 1:[/b] [i]Make your file like it says above, But on paint, not ImageReady[/i] [b]Step 2:[/b] [i]Make your thingy like it says above, Save it[/i] [b]Step 3:[/b] [i]Then open up ImageReady and go to file, then open[/i] [b]Step 4:[/b] [i]Then ur page will come up then go back to the other steps[/i]
[b]Original Steps:[/b]
[b]Step 4:[/b] [i]Go to Filter>blur>radial blur, put 60 as the amount, zoom, and at best. Then go back to radial blur and do spin. You will get something like this probably. DO NOT GIVE UP HERE CAUSE YOU DONT SEE ANYTHING[/i] [IMG]http://img141.imageshack.us/img141/9742/tutuv4.jpg[/img] [b]Step 5:[/b] [i]Do ctrl-i, then go to Filter>Styilze>Find edges and ctrl-I again. This is what you might get.[/i] [IMG]http://img179.imageshack.us/img179/1016/tutkw7.jpg[/img]
[b]Step 6:[/b] [i]Now do ctrl-u , click on colorize. The top one is the color, the middle one is the brightness (i use 100) and bottom is how light/dark it is, I suggest 5.[/i]
[b]Final Results:[/b] [IMG]http://img179.imageshack.us/img179/4439/tutxr1.jpg[/img]
[b]Credits:[/b] [i]95% me, 4.99% to adobe for making the program, and 0.01 to Cold Warscape V.2 for no apperant reason[/i]

item.title: Making some sweet graphixs [Tut]
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

This is exactly like my ‘Funky Background TUT’ except this part, you must of being doing my tut and instead of doing zoom, you did spin : [glow=red,2,300]Step 4: Go to Filter>blur>radial blur, put 60 as the amount, zoom, and at best. Then go back to radial blur and do spin. You will get something like this probably. DO NOT GIVE UP HERE CAUSE YOU DONT SEE ANYTHING[/glow]

So its about 90% ripped.

Read full topic

item.title: Making some sweet graphixs [Tut]
item.dc:creator: @billytal47 billytal47
item.description:
@billytal47 wrote:

Purpose: Make a spiral techno Backround for siggys and avatars.

Difficulty: 4/10

Assumed Knowledge: Know where to click, reading, and interperting, AND NOT TAKING REAL TOOLS

Program: Adobe ImageReady

Procedure

Original Steps:
Step 1: First open up a Blank Page about 150x200

Step 2: Take out your pen and scrible like this

Step 3: Then take out your paint bucket and fill some spaces in

Option Step:

If you cant find the pain bucket and pen on ImageReady, Use these steps

Step 1: Make your file like it says above, But on paint, not ImageReady
Step 2: Make your thingy like it says above, Save it
Step 3: Then open up ImageReady and go to file, then open
Step 4: Then ur page will come up then go back to the other steps

Original Steps:

Step 4: Go to Filter>blur>radial blur, put 60 as the amount, zoom, and at best. Then go back to radial blur and do spin. You will get something like this probably. DO NOT GIVE UP HERE CAUSE YOU DONT SEE ANYTHING

Step 5: Do ctrl-i, then go to Filter>Styilze>Find edges and ctrl-I again. This is what you might get.

Step 6: Now do ctrl-u , click on colorize. The top one is the color, the middle one is the brightness (i use 100) and bottom is how light/dark it is, I suggest 5.

Final Results:

Credits: 95% me, 4.99% to adobe for making the program, and 0.01 to Cold Warscape V.2 for no apperant reason

Read full topic
